metadata.titleCn: 祁连山综合观测网：黑河流域地表过程综合观测网（大满超级站涡动相关仪-2020）
metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from the Daman superstation eddy covariance system (EC) in the midstream reaches of the Heihe integrated observatory network from January 1 to December 31 in 2020. The site (100.37223° E, 38.85551° N) was located in the Zhangye City in Gansu Province. The elevation is 1556.06 m. The EC was installed at a height of 4.5 m, and the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (CSAT3&Li7500A) was 0.17 m.
The raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software, including the spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. The observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC): class 1-3 (high quality), class 4-6 (good), class 7-8 (poor, better than gap filling data), class9 (rejected). In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data collected before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 10% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day, and the missing data were replaced with -6999. Suspicious data were marked in red. 
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xls format. Detailed information can be found in the suggested references.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2018) (for sites information), Liu et al. (2011) for data processing) in the Citation section.
metadata.descriptionCn:
该数据集包含了2020年1月1日至2020年12月31日的黑河流域地表过程综合观测网中游大满超级站涡动相关仪观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市大满灌区内，下垫面是玉米。观测点的经纬度是100.37223E, 38.85551N，海拔1556.06m。涡动相关仪的架高4.5m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速温度仪（CSAT3）与CO2/H2O分析仪（Li7500A）之间的距离是17cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10Hz，发布的数据是采用Eddypro软件处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Eddypro软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据中每30min内缺失率大于10%的数据。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），奥布霍夫长度L（m），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为九级（质量标识1-3数据质量好，4-6数据质量较好，7-8数据质量较差（较插补数据好）；9数据质量差））。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
黑河流域地表过程综合观测网或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2018)，观测数据处理请参考Liu et al. (2011)。

background: Arid and semiarid regions represent approximately 30 % of the global terrestrial surface area (Dregne, 1991; Scanlon et al., 2006), and dryland expansion occurs under climate change, especially in developing countries (Huang et al., 2016). An oasis is a unique ecological landscape in arid and semi-arid areas that is not only the core of regions’ ecological environment but also the foundation of their economic development, especially in western China, which has been an important part of the “Silk Road” since ancient times. Oases comprising less than 10 % of the total area of arid regions support more than 90 % of the population in these regions of China (Chu et al., 2005; Li et al., 2016; Zhou et al., 2022). The oasis–desert system plays a crucial role in maintaining a stable ecological environment and agricultural productivity (Zhang and Zhao, 2015). Extensive studies have investigated energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas based on field and remote-sensing observations (Taha et al., 1991; Potchter et al., 2008; Xue et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2019; Zhou et al., 2022) and numerical simulations (Chu et al., 2005; Meng et al., 2009; Georgescu et al., 2011; Liu et al., 2020). In addition, oasis–desert areas located in semiarid regions have been found to be carbon sinks by previous researchers (Tagesson et al., 2016; Wang et al., 2019); thus, they can significantly affect the carbon balance of arid regions and play an increasingly important role within the global carbon cycle.
research objective: Therefore, it is critical to maintain the balance between oasis and desert systems in order to achieve the goal of sustainable oasis development. Understanding the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems is important to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis. A quantitative understanding of the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert areas is crucial to recognize the oasis–desert interactions and is significant to protect the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases; moreover, long-term observations are indispensable.
challenges: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas are facing the crisis of ecological environment degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, the degradation of natural vegetation, the intensification of land desertification, and the frequent occurrence of dust storms, especially in many inland river basins westward along the Silk Road, such as the Tarim River basin (Zhao et al., 2013), the Aral Sea basin (Stanev et al., 2004; Crétaux et al., 2009), and the Lake Urmia basin (Stone, 2015).
methods: In this study, we present a suite of observational datasets from artificial and natural oasis–desert systems that consist of long-term energy, water vapor, carbon and methane fluxes as well as auxiliary data involving hydrometeorology, vegetation, and soil parameters from 2012 to 2021. Half-hourly turbulent flux data were acquired by an eddy covariance system and scintillometer. The hydrometeorological data (including radiation, soil heat flux, and soil temperature profiles; gradients of air temperature and humidity and of wind speed and direction; and air pressure, precipitation, and soil moisture profiles) were observed from automatic weather stations with a 10 min average period as well as the groundwater table data. Moreover, vegetation and soil parameters were also supplemented in the datasets. The data processing and quality control procedure can be divided into data collection, data processing, and data archiving and sharing.
dataset: The study area comprises the middle and lower reaches of the HRB, located in the arid regions of western China, that receive water from the typical cryosphere of the upper reaches. A total of 11 land surface flux and meteorological stations have been established in these regions since 2012 – 2 superstations and 9 ordinary stations. The dataset of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange observations in oasis–desert areas reported in this study (including energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes; hydrometeorological data; and vegetation and soil parameters) is freely available from the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center.
backgroundCn: 干旱和半干旱地区约占全球陆地表面积的30%（Dregne, 1991；Scanlon et al., 2006），在气候变化的影响下，干旱地区的扩展尤其发生在发展中国家（Huang et al., 2016）。绿洲是干旱和半干旱地区独特的生态景观，不仅是这些地区生态环境的核心，也是经济发展的基础，特别是在中国西部，自古以来就是“丝绸之路”的重要组成部分。绿洲占干旱地区总面积的不到10%，却支持着中国这些地区90%以上的人口（Chu et al., 2005；Li et al., 2016；Zhou et al., 2022）。绿洲-沙漠系统在维持稳定的生态环境和农业生产力方面发挥着至关重要的作用（Zhang and Zhao, 2015）。大量研究基于实地和遥感观测（Taha et al., 1991；Potchter et al., 2008；Xue et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2019；Zhou et al., 2022）以及数值模拟（Chu et al., 2005；Meng et al., 2009；Georgescu et al., 2011；Liu et al., 2020）对绿洲-沙漠地区的能量、水汽和碳交换进行了广泛研究。此外，位于半干旱地区的绿洲-沙漠区域已被先前研究者发现为碳汇（Tagesson et al., 2016；Wang et al., 2019）；因此，它们可以显著影响干旱地区的碳平衡，并在全球碳循环中发挥越来越重要的作用。
research objectiveCn: 因此，维持绿洲与沙漠系统之间的平衡对于实现可持续绿洲发展的目标至关重要。了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征，对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标，以及支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展是非常重要的。对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并且对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义；此外，长期观测是不可或缺的。
challengesCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态环境退化的危机，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴频发，尤其是在丝绸之路沿线的许多内陆河流流域，如塔里木河流域（赵等，2013），咸海流域（Stanev等，2004；Crétaux等，2009）和乌尔米湖流域（Stone，2015）。
methodsCn: 在本研究中，我们呈现了一套来自人工和自然绿洲–沙漠系统的观测数据集，包括2012年至2021年的长期能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量，以及涉及水文气象、植被和土壤参数的辅助数据。半小时的湍流通量数据通过涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取。水文气象数据（包括辐射、土壤热通量和土壤温度剖面；空气温度和湿度的梯度，风速和风向的梯度；空气压力、降水和土壤湿度剖面）通过自动气象站以10分钟的平均周期进行观测，同时还观察了地下水位数据。此外，数据集中还补充了植被和土壤参数。数据处理和质量控制程序可以分为数据收集、数据处理和数据归档与共享。
datasetCn: 研究区域包括位于中国西部干旱地区的HRB中下游，水源来自上游典型的冰冻圈。自2012年以来，在这些地区建立了11个地表通量和气象站，包括2个超级站和9个普通站。本研究报告的绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水汽和碳交换观测数据集（包括能量、水汽和碳通量；水文气象数据；以及植被和土壤参数）可从国家西藏高原数据中心免费获取。

Verification.QuestionEn: Are there challenges related to ecological environment degradation in inland river basins within arid and semiarid regions?
Verification.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区的内陆河流流域中，是否存在与生态环境退化相关的挑战？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are data collection techniques for oasis–desert ecosystems more reliant on eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, or automatic weather stations?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，数据收集技术更依赖于涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪还是自动气象站？
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, automatic weather stations
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 涡度相关系统、闪烁仪、自动气象站

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Which method is more commonly used for processing eddy covariance data: Eddypro software or a custom data processing pipeline?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 处理涡度协方差数据时，哪种方法更常用：Eddypro软件还是自定义数据处理流程？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What is the primary data collection method used for observing surface processes in the Heihe River Basin?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域观察地表过程的主要数据收集方法是什么？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: Where are the observation stations located that provide data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in arid regions of western China?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 提供关于中国西部干旱地区能量、水汽和碳交换数据的观测站位于哪里？

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: When was the observational dataset of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, as well as auxiliary data, collected in oasis-desert systems?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠系统中，能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量以及辅助数据的观测数据集是在何时收集的？

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of data processing steps taken for eddy covariance data to ensure quality and reliability?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个处理涡度协方差数据的步骤示例，以确保数据的质量和可靠性？
Example.AnswerEn: Data processing steps for eddy covariance data include outlier removal, time delay correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, ultrasonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. These steps are necessary to ensure the quality and reliability of the processed data.
Example.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差数据的数据处理步骤包括异常值去除、时间延迟修正、坐标旋转、频率响应修正、超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正。这些步骤对于确保处理数据的质量和可靠性是必要的。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when collecting data on energy and carbon exchanges in inland river basins of arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区内陆河流流域收集能源和碳交换数据时面临的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: A challenge faced during data collection in inland river basins of arid regions includes environmental degradation, such as the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms, which can affect the stability and accuracy of ecological data collection.
Example.AnswerCn: 在干旱地区的内陆河流流域进行数据收集时面临的一个挑战是环境退化，例如河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴，这些都可能影响生态数据收集的稳定性和准确性。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the essential characteristics of eddy covariance systems used in the field of oasis-desert ecosystems?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统领域中，涡度协方差系统的基本特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: CSAT3 ultrasonic anemometer, Li7500A CO2/H2O analyzer, fixed height of 4.5 meters, sampling frequency of 10 Hz, oriented towards true north, 30-minute averages.
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: CSAT3超声波风速仪，Li7500A CO2/H2O分析仪，固定高度4.5米，采样频率10 Hz，朝向正北，30分钟平均值。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the primary features of datasets used to study energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in arid regions?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于研究干旱地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的数据集的主要特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: wind direction, wind speed, water vapor density, CO2 concentration, friction velocity, Obukhov length, sensible heat fluxes, latent heat fluxes, CO2 flux, radiation, soil heat flux, soil moisture profiles
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 风向、风速、水汽密度、二氧化碳浓度、摩擦速度、奥布霍夫长度、感热通量、潜热通量、二氧化碳通量、辐射、土壤热通量、土壤水分剖面

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many observation stations are established for collecting energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in the middle and lower reaches of the HRB since 2012?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 自2012年以来，在HRB中下游地区建立了多少个观测站用于收集能量、水汽和碳交换数据？

Definition.QuestionEn: What challenges are associated with data collection in arid and semiarid regions?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，数据收集面临哪些挑战？
Definition.AnswerEn: Data collection in arid and semiarid regions faces challenges such as ecological environment degradation, which includes the drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of natural vegetation, intensification of land desertification, and frequent dust storms. These challenges are particularly prevalent in inland river basins along the Silk Road, like the Tarim River basin, the Aral Sea basin, and the Lake Urmia basin. These environmental issues can affect the stability and accuracy of data collection in these regions.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，数据收集面临着生态环境退化等挑战，包括河流和湖泊干涸、自然植被退化、土地沙漠化加剧以及频繁的沙尘暴。这些挑战在丝绸之路沿线的内陆河流流域中尤为突出，如塔里木河流域、阿拉尔海流域和乌尔米耶湖流域。这些环境问题可能会影响这些地区数据收集的稳定性和准确性。

Definition.QuestionEn: What constitutes a comprehensive dataset for studying oasis–desert systems, and what types of data are typically included?
Definition.QuestionCn: 研究绿洲-沙漠系统的综合数据集包括哪些内容，通常包含哪些类型的数据？
Definition.AnswerEn: A comprehensive dataset for studying oasis–desert systems typically includes long-term observations of energy, water vapor, carbon, and methane fluxes, along with auxiliary hydrometeorological data. This involves radiation, soil heat flux, soil temperature profiles, air temperature and humidity gradients, wind speed and direction, air pressure, precipitation, soil moisture profiles, and groundwater table data. Additionally, vegetation and soil parameters are supplemented to provide a holistic understanding of the ecosystem dynamics in oasis–desert areas.
Definition.AnswerCn: 研究绿洲-沙漠系统的综合数据集通常包括对能量、水蒸气、碳和甲烷通量的长期观测，以及辅助的水文气象数据。这涉及辐射、土壤热通量、土壤温度剖面、空气温度和湿度梯度、风速和风向、气压、降水、土壤湿度剖面和地下水位数据。此外，植被和土壤参数的补充提供了对绿洲-沙漠地区生态系统动态的全面理解。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In terms of addressing challenges in arid and semiarid regions, how do the observational datasets from the middle and lower reaches of the HRB compare with those from other inland river basins like the Tarim River or Lake Urmia basin?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在应对干旱和半干旱地区的挑战方面，HRB中下游的观测数据集与其他内陆河流流域（如塔里木河或乌尔米湖流域）的数据集相比如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The observational datasets from the HRB focus on long-term energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, capturing the oasis–desert interactions crucial for ecological stability and socioeconomic development. In contrast, other inland river basins face similar ecological degradation challenges but might not have equivalent datasets available, highlighting a potential difference in data availability and research focus.
Comparison.AnswerCn: HRB的观测数据集专注于长期的能量、水汽和碳通量，捕捉到对生态稳定和社会经济发展至关重要的绿洲-沙漠相互作用。相比之下，其他内陆河流流域面临类似的生态退化挑战，但可能没有相应的数据集可用，这突显了数据可用性和研究重点的潜在差异。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How do data collection methods using eddy covariance systems contribute to understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 使用涡度相关系统的数据收集方法如何有助于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水汽和碳交换？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems provide half-hourly turbulent flux data, which are essential for quantifying energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert ecosystems. This detailed monitoring helps in recognizing the interactions between these systems, supporting ecological stability and socioeconomic development by providing long-term observational data critical for sustainable development goals.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统提供半小时的湍流通量数据，这对于量化绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。这种详细的监测有助于识别这些系统之间的相互作用，通过提供对可持续发展目标至关重要的长期观测数据，支持生态稳定和社会经济发展。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise in maintaining data quality and accuracy when collecting long-term observational datasets in arid and semiarid regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区收集长期观察数据集时，维护数据质量和准确性可能会面临哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Challenges in maintaining data quality and accuracy include dealing with ecological degradation such as drying rivers and lakes, land desertification, and dust storms. These factors can affect the reliability of instruments like eddy covariance systems and automatic weather stations, necessitating rigorous data processing and quality control procedures to ensure reliable data for understanding ecological interactions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 维护数据质量和准确性面临的挑战包括应对生态退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、土地沙漠化以及沙尘暴。这些因素可能影响涡度协方差系统和自动气象站等仪器的可靠性，因此需要严格的数据处理和质量控制程序，以确保获取可靠的数据来理解生态相互作用。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: In what ways can data from hydrometeorological observations and vegetation/soil parameters enhance our understanding of oasis–desert system dynamics?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 来自水文气象观测和植被/土壤参数的数据可以通过哪些方式增强我们对绿洲-沙漠系统动态的理解？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Hydrometeorological observations and vegetation/soil parameters provide auxiliary data that complement flux measurements, offering a comprehensive view of the ecosystem. This data can enhance understanding by revealing how different environmental variables interact, thereby aiding in the assessment of oasis–desert dynamics such as energy balance, water cycles, and carbon fluxes, which are crucial for managing ecological stability and achieving carbon neutrality.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 水文气象观测和植被/土壤参数提供了辅助数据，补充了通量测量，提供了生态系统的全面视角。这些数据可以通过揭示不同环境变量之间的相互作用来增强理解，从而有助于评估绿洲-沙漠动态，如能量平衡、水循环和碳通量，这对于管理生态稳定性和实现碳中和至关重要。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to the need for specific data processing steps such as coordinate rotation and frequency response correction when handling eddy covariance data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致在处理涡度协方差数据时需要特定数据处理步骤（如坐标旋转和频率响应校正）的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The need for specific data processing steps like coordinate rotation and frequency response correction arises from the requirements to accurately interpret turbulent fluxes and other measurements in eddy covariance data. These steps help in correcting for any misalignments of the sensor with respect to the wind flow and in compensating for the attenuation of high-frequency signals, ensuring the reliability and accuracy of the observed data.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 特定数据处理步骤，如坐标旋转和频率响应校正的需求，源于准确解释涡度协方差数据中的湍流通量和其他测量值的要求。这些步骤有助于纠正传感器与风流之间的任何不对齐，并补偿高频信号的衰减，从而确保观测数据的可靠性和准确性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is there a necessity to exclude data around precipitation events and during instrument errors in flux measurements?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在通量测量中有必要排除降水事件和仪器错误期间的数据？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Excluding data around precipitation events and during instrument errors is necessary because these conditions can introduce anomalies and inaccuracies in flux measurements. Precipitation can affect the sensor's ability to measure certain variables accurately, and instrument errors can result in unreliable data, thus necessitating their removal to maintain data quality.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 排除降水事件和仪器错误期间的数据是必要的，因为这些条件可能会引入异常和不准确的通量测量。降水可能会影响传感器准确测量某些变量的能力，而仪器错误可能导致数据不可靠，因此需要去除这些数据以保持数据质量。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons for conducting long-term observations in oasis–desert ecosystems to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 进行对绿洲-沙漠生态系统的长期观察，以了解能量、水蒸气和碳交换的原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Long-term observations in oasis–desert ecosystems are crucial to understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange due to the complex interactions and variability over time. These ecosystems are vital for maintaining ecological stability and agricultural productivity, and understanding their dynamics is essential for achieving sustainable development and ecological security. Long-term data collection provides insights into seasonal and annual trends, which are critical for informed management and policy decisions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，长期观察对于理解能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要，因为这些生态系统的相互作用和时间变化非常复杂。这些生态系统对维持生态稳定性和农业生产力至关重要，理解它们的动态对于实现可持续发展和生态安全至关重要。长期数据收集提供了对季节性和年度趋势的洞察，这对于制定明智的管理和政策决策至关重要。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of implementing quality control and data processing procedures in the collection of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange data in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中实施质量控制和数据处理程序对能量、水蒸气和碳交换数据的收集可能产生的结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Implementing quality control and data processing procedures can result in more reliable and accurate data, which is crucial for understanding the energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems. It supports ecological security and sustainable development by ensuring data integrity, which is necessary for achieving goals like carbon peaking and neutrality.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 实施质量控制和数据处理程序可以产生更可靠和准确的数据，这对于理解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的能量、水蒸气和碳交换至关重要。它通过确保数据完整性来支持生态安全和可持续发展，这是实现碳达峰和碳中和等目标所必需的。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to understand the basic characteristics of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems for sustainable development?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么了解绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的基本特征对可持续发展很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Understanding these characteristics is crucial to achieve the goals of carbon peaking and carbon neutrality in the oasis–desert area and support the ecological security and sustainable development of the oasis.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 理解这些特征对于实现绿洲-沙漠地区的碳达峰和碳中和目标至关重要，并支持绿洲的生态安全和可持续发展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the objectives of maintaining long-term observational datasets for energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes in oasis–desert systems?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 维护绿洲-沙漠系统中能量、水蒸气和碳通量的长期观测数据集的目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The objective is to gain quantitative understanding of the oasis–desert interactions, which is significant for protecting the ecological stability and socioeconomic development of oases.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是获得对绿洲与沙漠相互作用的定量理解，这对保护绿洲的生态稳定性和社会经济发展具有重要意义。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it necessary to establish a network of land surface flux and meteorological stations in arid regions like the Heihe River Basin?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么有必要在像黑河流域这样的干旱地区建立陆地表面通量和气象站网络？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Establishing this network helps in collecting comprehensive datasets that include energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, which are essential for understanding the ecological and hydrometeorological dynamics of these regions.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 建立这个网络有助于收集包括能量、水汽和碳通量在内的综合数据集，这些数据对于理解这些地区的生态和水文气象动态至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are followed to ensure the quality and reliability of data collected from eddy covariance systems in arid oasis-desert regions?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 为了确保从干旱绿洲-沙漠地区的涡度协方差系统收集的数据的质量和可靠性，遵循哪些程序？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data is processed using Eddypro software which includes steps like outlier removal, time lag correction, coordinate rotation, frequency response correction, sonic virtual temperature correction, and density (WPL) correction. Data quality is evaluated based on atmospheric stability and turbulence characteristics, and further filtering is performed by removing erroneous instrument data, excluding data during precipitation, and excluding data with over 10% missing rate in 30-minute intervals.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据使用Eddypro软件处理，包括异常值去除、时间滞后修正、坐标旋转、频率响应修正、声学虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正。数据质量根据大气稳定性和湍流特征进行评估，并通过去除错误的仪器数据、排除降水期间的数据以及排除30分钟间隔内缺失率超过10%的数据进行进一步过滤。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What steps are involved in the data archiving and sharing process for datasets related to oasis-desert systems in the Heihe River Basin?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 与黑河流域的绿洲-沙漠系统相关的数据集的数据归档和共享过程涉及哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The data processing and quality control procedure includes data collection, processing, and subsequent archiving and sharing. The dataset, which includes energy, water vapor, and carbon fluxes, along with hydrometeorological, vegetation, and soil parameters, is made available through the National Tibetan Plateau Data Center, ensuring accessibility for further research and analysis.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据处理和质量控制程序包括数据收集、处理以及后续的归档和共享。该数据集包含能量、水汽和碳通量，以及水文气象、植被和土壤参数，通过国家西藏高原数据中心提供，确保可供进一步研究和分析。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technologies or instruments are essential for collecting data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中收集能量、水汽和碳交换数据所需的关键技术或仪器是什么？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The collection of data on energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis-desert ecosystems is enabled by technologies such as eddy covariance systems, scintillometers, and automatic weather stations. These instruments measure various parameters including turbulent flux, radiation, soil heat flux, air temperature, humidity, wind speed, and soil moisture profiles.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，能量、水汽和碳交换的数据收集得益于涡度协方差系统、闪烁仪和自动气象站等技术。这些仪器测量各种参数，包括湍流通量、辐射、土壤热通量、空气温度、湿度、风速和土壤湿度剖面。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What are the conditions necessary for establishing a comprehensive observation network in desert-oasis ecosystems to support sustainable development?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 建立沙漠-绿洲生态系统综合观测网络以支持可持续发展的必要条件有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Establishing a comprehensive observation network in desert-oasis ecosystems requires conditions such as strategic location selection in critical areas like the middle and lower reaches of river basins, long-term observational capabilities, and the integration of diverse datasets including energy, water vapor, carbon fluxes, hydrometeorological data, and vegetation and soil parameters. Collaboration with data centers for data archiving and sharing is also essential.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在沙漠-绿洲生态系统中建立一个综合观察网络需要满足一些条件，例如在河流流域的中下游关键区域进行战略性位置选择、具备长期观测能力，以及整合包括能量、水汽、碳通量、气象水文数据以及植被和土壤参数在内的多样化数据集。与数据中心的合作以实现数据存档和共享也是至关重要的。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might there be challenges in obtaining accurate measurements of carbon, water vapor, and energy exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，获取碳、水蒸气和能量交换的准确测量可能面临挑战的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological degradation challenges, such as river and lake drying and vegetation degradation, which complicate accurate measurement. Furthermore, the complex interactions between oasis and desert systems require long-term and precise observations to understand energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is crucial for maintaining ecological stability and supporting sustainable development.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 内陆河流盆地在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态退化的挑战，例如河流和湖泊干涸以及植被退化，这使得准确测量变得复杂。此外，绿洲与沙漠系统之间的复杂相互作用需要长期和精确的观测，以理解能量、水汽和碳的交换，这对维持生态稳定和支持可持续发展至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected benefits of using eddy covariance systems and scintillometers in data collection for oasis–desert ecosystem studies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪在绿洲-沙漠生态系统研究中的数据收集预期带来的好处是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Eddy covariance systems and scintillometers provide crucial half-hourly turbulent flux data that enhance the quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchanges in oasis–desert areas. This data is essential for recognizing interactions within these ecosystems, contributing to ecological stability and supporting socioeconomic development of oases by providing insights necessary for achieving carbon peaking and neutrality goals.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪提供关键的半小时湍流通量数据，这些数据增强了对绿洲-沙漠地区能量、水蒸气和碳交换的定量理解。这些数据对于识别这些生态系统内的相互作用至关重要，有助于生态稳定，并通过提供实现碳达峰和碳中和目标所需的见解，支持绿洲的社会经济发展。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the processing and quality control of observational data be particularly challenging in the context of oasis–desert ecosystems?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 为什么在绿洲-沙漠生态系统中，观测数据的处理和质量控制可能特别具有挑战性？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The complex environmental conditions in oasis–desert ecosystems, such as land desertification and frequent dust storms, present significant challenges for data accuracy and reliability. The data processing and quality control procedures need to account for these factors to ensure the integrity of the data, which involves steps like error data removal, precipitation-related data exclusion, and handling missing data during the collection and processing phases.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 绿洲-沙漠生态系统中的复杂环境条件，如土地沙漠化和频繁的沙尘暴，对数据的准确性和可靠性提出了重大挑战。数据处理和质量控制程序需要考虑这些因素，以确保数据的完整性，这涉及到错误数据的删除、与降水相关的数据排除，以及在收集和处理阶段处理缺失数据的步骤。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in ensuring the quality and accuracy of data collected through eddy covariance systems in arid and semi-arid regions?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 在干旱和半干旱地区，通过涡度协方差系统收集数据时，确保数据质量和准确性可能面临的挑战有哪些？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Inland river basins in arid and semiarid areas face ecological challenges such as river and lake drying, vegetation degradation, and increased dust storms, which may affect data collection. Ensuring data quality involves steps like outlier removal, delay correction, and frequency response adjustment, all of which require careful methodological application.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 内陆河流流域在干旱和半干旱地区面临生态挑战，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化以及沙尘暴增加，这可能影响数据收集。确保数据质量涉及诸如异常值去除、延迟修正和频率响应调整等步骤，这些都需要谨慎的方法应用。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How might the use of long-term observational datasets enhance the understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 长期观测数据集的使用如何增强对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水蒸气和碳交换的理解？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Long-term observational datasets are crucial for quantitatively understanding energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange, which is essential for recognizing oasis–desert interactions. This understanding supports ecological stability and sustainable development goals, especially in the context of achieving carbon neutrality and peaking targets.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 长期观测数据集对于定量理解能量、水汽和碳交换至关重要，这对于认识绿洲与沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要。这种理解支持生态稳定和可持续发展目标，特别是在实现碳中和和碳排放峰值目标的背景下。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how data collection methods in oasis–desert systems manage to ensure the accuracy and reliability of energy, water vapor, and carbon flux data.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白在绿洲-沙漠系统中，数据收集方法如何确保能量、水蒸气和碳通量数据的准确性和可靠性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The data collection methods involve using an eddy covariance system and scintillometer for half-hourly turbulent flux data, along with automatic weather stations for hydrometeorological data with a 10-minute average period. The process includes rigorous data processing and quality control to maintain data accuracy and reliability.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 数据收集方法包括使用涡度协方差系统和闪烁仪获取半小时的湍流通量数据，以及使用自动气象站获取10分钟平均的水文气象数据。该过程包括严格的数据处理和质量控制，以保持数据的准确性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about the challenges faced in collecting long-term observational data in arid and semi-arid inland river basins.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对在干旱和半干旱内陆河流流域收集长期观察数据所面临的挑战感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in these regions include ecological environment degradation, such as drying up of rivers and lakes, degradation of vegetation, intensification of desertification, and dust storms, which complicate long-term data collection efforts.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 这些地区面临的挑战包括生态环境退化，如河流和湖泊干涸、植被退化、沙漠化加剧以及沙尘暴，这些都使长期数据收集工作变得复杂。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don’t understand how these datasets can provide insights into the sustainable development of oasis–desert systems.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白这些数据集如何能提供关于绿洲-沙漠系统可持续发展的见解。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The datasets offer quantitative understanding of energy, water vapor, and carbon exchange in oasis–desert ecosystems, which is crucial for recognizing oasis–desert interactions and supports ecological stability and socioeconomic development goals, thereby aiding sustainable development.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 这些数据集提供了对绿洲-沙漠生态系统中能量、水汽和碳交换的定量理解，这对于认识绿洲-沙漠之间的相互作用至关重要，并支持生态稳定和社会经济发展目标，从而有助于可持续发展。
